page.title: 01FARMING AREAS
page.content: This area remains very much the same as in the original domesday survey, i.e.mainly farmland. The main difference lies in the advances made in farming techniques over the last 900 years. The small mixed farms have disappeared and with them the small communities and smaller dwelling places and cottages. There are now 22 working farms who between them own three quarters of the area. Most of the land is in agricultural use for the production of wheat, barley and rape seed. Many of the fields are being opened up, but there are still some hedges left, mainly along the roadside boudaries. The tree cover is sparce and there are no woods or thickets. Most of the older trees are boundary markers and the new trees have been planted to compliment the countryside.
